It's much easier to correct something

where you can say,

you can continuously improve your model. Because we think

The one last note
that I would say on datasets, and this is a slight rule of thumb is,

in terms of the number
of samples you need, it's often good to think about
how hard your problem is. So if it's a really
straightforward problem,

and you're going to have... It looks like X and I'm going to find X, then you probably need
a really small set of images.

But if you're talking about
really minute differences - the example I often bring up is the difference between a gerbil
and a hamster -

they look awfully similar. You'll probably need
a few more examples there because those differences
are very fine-grained differences.
